page.title: 10WHO CAN AFFORD TO LIVE HERE?
page.content: There is no shortage of people who want to live here.Many young couples would dearly love to start or bring up their families in a country area but the cost of housing is prohibitive. As part of a conservation area there is a restriction on new building.The few new houses available tend to be 4- bedroom detached expensive properties beyond the reach of a single income family.Also as the use of natural stone is a stipulation this adds to the cost of any new housing. Older houses often in a poor state of repair also command high prices due to their potential renovated value as homes for the rich and retired.In some cases 2 or 3 cottages are converted to a single home. Council house provision consists of 2 blocks of semi's near Yarlington a recent application for another failed.
